review_body: This was a very comfortable and pleasant stay! The room is VERY small but all the essentials are there — including a wonderful soaking tub. The bed has very lovely down pillows, according to my husband. I'm allergic to down, but a staff member very kindly offered me a memory foam pillow as a replacement. I really loved that they include an electric tea kettle and mugs, and offer complimentary teas at the front desk!The staff overall was pleasant and helpful, and I really appreciated the complimentary lotions and face masks made available. The hotel itself is right by the Kinshicho JR station, which can be used to get to Narita airport with no transfers, and there are a number of great restaurants right in the vicinity. Will definitely consider staying here again if we return to Toyko!

Nice stay. Located near station and many foods, mall nearby. They provide "Handy phone" for searching, use the map etc for free (like a smartphone), so i can access and mobile to places arround Tokyo easily. They also provide skincare and good coffee for free. The room clean, the staff really friendly. I have a good stay. Will back here if I visit Tokyo next time.

Do not stay at Fresa Inn if you want space! We booked a room for 2 and it was small like a sardine can. Double bed is actually for 1, and is like a super single. Went to the counter to ask if we could pay for an upgrade, they said yes but charged us 7000yen a night. I told the guy that if that’s the case I’m better off booking another room because rates were low due to the coronavirus. He said “please go ahead and do”. “This is a business hotel and Tokyo rooms are small like this!”. Good lord, they are not even full and it doesn’t hurt to offer upgrade for a smaller sum. Rude staff but the amenities were ok. Free face mask at lobby, etc. Good location too.

It was my first time travelling alone and i was really nervous at first. However, the staff at the hotel speak perfect English and made my check-in process smooth. They are also very welcoming, greeting me whenever i leave and come back! This made me feel at home. Not to mention, the cleanliness of the hotel is superb! The location is perfect too! 5mins walk to the train station(which is also home to 2-3 super markets) made it very convenient for my day-to-day travelling. Would definitely recommend this to anyone wanting to stay near the station with an abundance of amenities nearby! 10/10 would come back again for my next trip! Thank you Fresa Inn Kinshicho for being awesome!

Very good service and polite.Simple and easy check-in / check-out process.Free coffee is good but it just serve from 15:00 - 24:00, Better to change from morning to evening.Clean and tidy room.Location is good (Near JR line & metro station)

For someone who is a food-lover, I would recommend this place. Also this is very near to the station.The place itself has friendly staffs and the room is very clean.The accomodation also offers a mobile phone which I think can also act as a pocket wifi.

Fresa Inn Tokyo-Kinshicho is very modern, clean and new-looking. comfortable bed and facilities and friendly staff with an easy checkout function. Very close to Jr Kinshicho and subway stations and would definitely stay again. Only gripe i have is the razors/shavers dont work very well.

The location is great, just a few block away from MRT station. The room space is not really large but it's enough for two people with two luggages. Also very clean room and good service make traveling more comfortable.

This is an anniversary vacation and staying in Fresa Inn made it more special.Really good location and very clean rooms. Staff very accommodating and pleasant. Highly recommend and will come back again.

We spent 6 nights in the triple room at the hotel. Everything is perfect!!! The room is fit for 3 people with space for our luggages.The room is also clean cozy and comfortable.Hotel staffs are friendly.

The location is perfect of near the metro or the JR station. This makes the traveling more convenient. Also there is a convenient store and some restaurant nearby. So that will be any problem for finding food or having meal. BTW, there were also two malls across it.

This was my first time in Tokyo and we wanted a hotel with good location and budget (in Tokyo means) price. Paid 430 USD for 7 nights and were more than satisfied. Location is perfect - a little bit far away from Tokyo's hustle but very convenient in terms of transportation and services in surrounded areas. Very quiet area but close to transportation hub and numerous eatings around. Parco, OIOI, Olines shopping malls just a few step away, Kinshischo station just in a few minutes walking. The room is small but very tidy and clean, free tea and coffee amenities, ice machine and microwave oven at second floor. Overall highly recommended got a short Tokyo stay. We will surely come back sometime.

We had a connecting room with 4 beds during our stay. Room was unclean (i.e., bed did not appear to change apparently from last check-out guests, and bathroom smells, etc.). Room size is very small in spite of the family room but it is expected for Tokyo standard.

a great location which a couple minutes walk to the train station. there are so many restaurants near the hotel. all staff are great! they are friendly and helpful. the room is super clean and the facilities was all we needed.

Stayed for 6 nights. Room was small- not able to leave luggage open but bed size (queen) and toilet was not compromised. Love the amenities they provide at the lobby such as bath salt and green tea. they even have complimentary sake for the new year. It is 5 mins away from Kinshicho station, yet is not noisy at all. For the price and location, we will consider staying there again!

I booked this hotel via their own website back in May using a site-exclusive early bird discount, prices were slightly lower there than on third-party websites. My room, a Compact Single, costed an average of 55 dollars per night except on weekends where it increased slightly (nothing too ridiculous though).The hotel was just a 5 minute walk from JR/Tokyo Metro Kinshicho Station and featured a plethora of shops and restaurants to choose from (there's 3 shopping malls within a 10 minute walk + a 24H FamilyMart behind the hotel). The staff at reception were very kind and accommodating, and even though their English skills weren't that great they did the best they could. I had requested a Compact Single room in the upper floors of the hotel for a better view of the train tracks and they were able to fulfill this request (even though they had warned me the rooms might not be available during my stay). The room was small and my luggage didn't fit well, but this is to be expected by Tokyo standards so I didn't mind. One thing this hotel has that other Fresa Inns don't are free smartphones with unlimited data. While I had already rented a portable Wi-Fi router this could be "handy" for travelers on a budget. Speaking of the Wi-Fi - that worked perfectly fine during the whole trip (12th floor) and power plugs are plentiful (including one right next to your bed in a cubby hole). Bathroom was entirely plastic and had a bunch of amenities avaliable (the hair dryer was in one of the desk's drawers and more amenities could be found for free in reception). Minifridge worked even without the card inserted into the powerslot and kept decently cool. TV was entirely Japanese channels. The hotel also offers what they call "eco-cleaning" - they'll take out the trash and make the beds but nothing else, and you get a free water bottle for doing this.Breakfast was carried out in a dining area that (I believe) operated as a regular restaurant the rest of the day. Food was a mix between Japanese and Western meals, nothing too fancy taste-wise but not completely inedible either. Free coffee was available in reception.One thing I didn't quite like was how the whole laundry thing was handled. There were only two washing/drying machines on the second floor and they got filled up almost constantly the whole day. It should, nevertheless, be pointed out that the hotel does provide laundry service at a slightly higher price than the washing machines. Furthermore guests would leave their laundry in the machines and take their sweet time to pick them up (this isn't the hotel's fault). The vending machine in this room - the only one in the entire hotel - ran out of merch by the 4th day of my stay.Aside from that, however, my stay at the Kinshicho Fresa Inn was excellent. I would once again like to thank the staff for their courteous treatment during my entire stay (regardless of language barrier). Wouldn't doubt (and heck, probably will in the very near future) staying here again in the near future, not one bit!

Good location with a few minutes walk to JR and Hanzomon line. It’s quite near Tokyo Skytree with 10 minutes walk.Friendly staffs, clean room and good facilities.Good choice with a super reasonable price.

Overall, I enjoyed my experience with this hotel. The receptionists were all very polite and friendly, and the room was clean and cozy. Furthermore, the location is great because you will have two department stores, a 24-hour supermarket and the Kinshichyo station within walking distance.

The hotel location is the best! Just walk 5 min from JR Kinshicho and metro Kinshicho (hanzomon line) too. First time I stay in Kinshicho area and there're many restaurant and shopping mall around (OIOI, KIT, Parco). If you are travel to & from Narita Airport, you can take the JR Sobu line directly too (no transfer no exchange!), it need about 1hrs 20min. (it's take longer compare to Keisei Skyliner (40min)). We will definitely come back to stay here again in future!

The room we stayed was very clean and easy to access. The staff are very friendly and welcoming which is really trademark of Japanese hospitality. Definitely returning here next time. Keep up the good work team

Very good hotel in Tokyo near JR/Metro (250 m.) and near many restaurant. Room is very clean and normal small.Have to you key card for lift(so safety). And near shopping mall also.Shall be come back again

This was our second stay here. Came back because it was clean, convenient and well priced. Staff are ultra friendly and greet you every time you pass by reception. Nothing is too much trouble. We arrived before our room was ready and did not have to wait as we were moved to another room by staff. Most staff speak English.

The staff are very polite, giving any good advice we seek. Checking in time so quick and so do the check out time. Room quality is not a problem for short term staying, great thing is the hotel is nearer to the station, easy to walk around.

I stayed here for 5 nights and very happy about it. This hotel is very close to the station and it was convenient. The hotel has nice amenities that all women appreciate! The bed was comfortable, staffs were kind. The price was generous. If the price does not change so much then I will defenetlry stay here again when I need to stay in Tokyo.

Typhoon Hagibis came to Japan on the last day of our travel, I was wondering if there was possible to change our stay from 5 nights to 4 nights. A trainee waiter was so kind for us to contact booking.com and told us about the detail of refund. It's really touching for foreigners who were so worried about the bad weather disappointing their travel. I certainly will choose to stay in this hotel again when come to Tokyo next time.

Ideal location for tourist like us. very near the train station. One station away from Tokyo skytree.They also have complete amenities. We were able to wash our clothes before check out. The location is a nice travel spot itself. It has a nearby mall, and combinis are just within proximities.The staffs are very accommodating even to a non nihonggo speaking guests. We were able to transact with them smoothly. They even have a luggage weighing scale at the lobby to make sure you won't go over your luggage limit.Overall we are very satisfied and we will definitely come back. All the best Sotetsu Fesna Inn.

Sotetsu Fresa Inn Kinshicho is a great location! We came with a big group (over 25 ppl) It’s close to restaurants, grocery and department stores, and is a short walking distance to train stations. Very friendly and helpful staff. Clean facility all throughout. I highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed here for a week and we truly love the place. It is highly accessible, clean and well maintained facility with best customer service. The front desk always greet us with a smile and we always look forward returning to our room after a full day out in the city. We are so grateful that Staff prepared room decoration in our bed and small gift when we arrived for our anniversary trip! We truly appreciate the effort. I also love their ladies amenities; facial cleanser, toner, moisturizer, face mask, hair accessory. Basically almost everything a lady like me will need to pamper our skin. So Love It! Tea choices and Coffee are also great to sip after a tiring day. We love our stay so we will be back here again, for sure!

This hotel is a 3 min walk from Kinshichō station (JR), or about 10 min from Tokyo Sky Tree.Very helpful and friendly staff, rooms were cleaned every day. On a front desk it is always possible to take tea (it is not in room), salt for the bathroom, shaving gel, face packs.In each room provide phone with the Internet which can use outside hotel - used it for navigation according to Google Maps, - so there is no need to get a sim cardAt the next trip we will surely return to this hotel

It is very convenient to go there as it can be directly reached by JR, the surrounding district is fantastics: there are 3 big shopping malls, 1 cinema, 4 supermarkets as well as different restaurants to choose. The room is very nice, as I directly booked my stay through the hotel webpage, when I checked in I was upgraded to 1 grade higher as well as in the corner (or bigger room)! The hotel provides various amentities for free enjoyment such as bath salt, tea bags or even facial products, I believe all ladies would find this very very helpful. BTW, if you join their official hotel membership, you can extend your check out time 1 hour later. The reception staff knew I was a foreigner even allowed me to check out 2 hours later!!! I

Everything was OK. Nice people, perfect location (close to metro and train station) and very good breakfast. The only negative point is the size of the rooms but with imagination you overcome the issue.

This hotel is a 3 min walk from Kinshichō station (JR), or about 10 min taxi ride from Tokyo station (approx 2400 yen). We booked a 3 person room which was very clean and quiet. Basic amenities like fridge, kettle, hair dryer, air-con and TV. There are some items you can collect from the foyer for your comfort - tea, coffee, toothbrush etc.Staff are very friendly and spoke English, so check in was easy. Close to 7-11 for snacks and several places for dinner. Check out was via vending machines in foyer - fast!!

Clean, comfortable, lots of restaurants and bars nearby, close to railway station. Hotel breakfast was a little mediocre but again, plenty of alternatives nearby. Friendliest housekeepers I've ever met.

Pros - 5 minute walk to Kinshicho Station , 3 min walk to family mart and easy access to eatery place and shopping mall. You can even see the SkyTree Tower a step away from the hotel. Amenities offered are great. Cons - Extension hour is chargeable after 10am at ¥1,400 with no negotiation , staff need to be more attentive with guest check in , we were not allow to check in early (12pm +) even though we had a long night flight, as this is hotel policy so its fair enough. We were only informed that the room is ready when we approached the counter at 3pm and our luggage are already in the room, while we were resting in front of them all the time , they couldn’t even tell us that our room is ready early??? Cleanliness is so so.

The best budget hotel I've stayed in Tokyo so far. Room is clean, you can help yourself with tea/coffee, bathroom amenities, heat up foods using their microwave. The property is nicely located near residential areas, which we like, because we can go to their local supermarkets and get vibes of the locals. One of the best perks of the hotel - free smartphone to help you with Google Maps or urgent Internet access. Slow phone, but works! I'd recommend this chain highly and most likely be coming back to stay again myself.

The hotel location is close to the JR and metro stations which just requires around 5 minutes walking distance. The room is comfortable but relatively small and quick difficult to pack or unpack the luggage. There are many restaurants and have supermarkets, convenience stores nearby the hotel and therefore no need to worry about the food and drink. The staff are friendly and helpful. Will come again next time when visiting Tokyo.

This nanna and friend also a nanna stayed here after a lengthy search for our visit to Japan, I am so glad I stayed with this hotel for 7 nights, close to the train station and one stop from skytree and only a few stops to other places we wanted to go to, close to shopping centres, 7/11, restaurants, our twin room was small but it's what I expected and we adapted, beds were super comfy, air con, nice deep bath and overhead shower, and of course heated toilet with all the bells and whistles, rooms made up every day and cleaned, the one thing we missed was no milk, coffee, tea or sugars in room but some were complimentary in the foyer along with coffee machine there and again we adapted and bought those from 7/11 to keep in our room, laundry was easy to find and reasonable price, staff were amazing and ready to help with anything, available baggage storage on our last day and a beautiful gesture of a birthday card and small present for myself from staff, would definitely choose to stay here again :)

I booked a single room for 3 nights. This hotel provided friendly services (introduction to the hotel and storage service after checkout) and the room was very clean. And the interior of the room is quite modern. The location of the hotel was very good. I easily reached to airport and Ginza and Akihabara.

Glad to pick this place for our 4 nights stay in the city. The train station (both JR and Metro) is just 5 minutes walk from the hotel, along the walk there’s multiple marts like Family Mart, 7-11 and plenty restaurants, some bars and ramen shops. Hotel is new, very clean and friendly staff. I’ll like to say special thanks to Mika for her warm and friendly personality:):)

Booked a single room for three nights. The room was very clean and modern in appearance, bed was comfortable and overall the place was very quiet (either good soundproofing or corteous guests!). Lately l have been using Airbnb instead of hotels so not sure if this something new but the free smartphone to use when out and about was really useful (if like me you have a mobile provider who doesn't include Japan in their international roaming package), local calls only but l only needed web access for Google Maps and looking up things.Convenient location too being only a very short walk to Kinschico station.As the title says my stay exceeded expectations and l would definitely stay here again.

This hotel first opened in December 2017 and its location is close to Kinshicho Railway station in Tokyo. Several bus lines also operate from Kinshicho station. Shopping centres and many eateries also are a nearby feature. The hotel itself is spotlessly clean and the service is great, though, not insurmountable, the English language can be a bit of a problem at times. The rooms are (typical for Japan) small, as is the bed, which is a bit narrower than a normal double bed, the bathroom is well equipped and feature a very deep bath with movable shower above. Everything is spotlessly clean! The bed is a bit too small and uncomfortable for 2 tall people. We had 4 suitcases and had trouble navigating around them. No wardrobes, only a few hangers on the wall. We stayed 4 nights and encountered no noise. For another visit to Tokyo, we would consider the hotel again for 1 night, but for a longer visit we would be looking for a hotel with larger rooms (and beds!).

The room was modern and clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. There were plenty of power points and free wi-fi, plus there are many dining and shopping options within 5 minutes' walk. Would stay again!

Very comfortable and clean and modern rooms with almost everything needed in a hotel room found in a compact but easily usable space. Excellent bathroom, comfortable ( single ) beds and given the proximity to the rail line we couldn’t hear anything from outside with the window locked closed.Very convenient location close to Kinshicho station and short commute to Tokyo central. Only criticism, and this could be petty and a normal occurance given this was our first time and accomodation in Japan, was the lack of power point AC/DC adaption in the bathroom for electric shavers or personal hairdryers. All in all we enjoyed our stay hear immensely and say thank you to all of the very friendly and helpful staff at the Sotetsu Fresa Inn

Happy with the location, Kinshicho is a good base in Tokyo. The hotel is great: lovely service from the staff, happy with the facilities and the additional perks. Small room and bath though, which is common in Japan for this price range, but it’s up-to-date. Overall, a practical, modern hotel.

The food here was pretty good. Its close to the kinshicho train station and was pretty easy to find. They provided plugins to charge your devices which I found quite handy as many other hotels dont. Reasonable price aswell.Thumbs up from me

We wanted a hotel that is a good location but was not going to cost the earth. We looked at the Conrad and other well know chain hotels but after reading reviews on trip adviser on this hotel we thought why not...We travelled with a six month old baby and this hotel worked great for us! It’s not the most spacious of rooms (large double) but it worked for us for 9 nights. It’s a great hotel, staff are very welcoming and will help you with anything. Lots of good restaurants close by to eat from and we had a excellent time in Tokyo and staying here. The other great thing about the hotel was the laundry room when travelling with a baby - excellent addition and didn’t cost the earth!!! 300 yen to wash and 100 yen for every 30 minutes to use the dryer. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay again if we ever come back to Tokyo!!!

Hotel is located on south exit of JR Kinshicho Station. Just turn right and walk ahead for only 2 blocks (3 mins walk). Receptionists are welcoming you with a big smile. There is coffee/tea corner for your refreshment during the afternoon time until midnight, smoking room is next to it (there's a room for smoker with the sealed door). There's a complimentary amenities shelf next to reception: aroma bath, face wash, toner, hair wax, shower cap, shower sponge and tea bags (darjeeling, blueberries tea, strawberries tea, etc.)(Ladies amenities available at Front Desk).At 2nd floor, there are washing machines, vendor machines, microwave oven and ice machine. You can get a cup of ice and buying some drinks at vendor machines.Breakfast at 1st floor Shiki dining restaurant.Room is small but it's acceptable as you are in Tokyo. Room is fully equipped with necessary amenities. At opposite side of hotel entrance door is Thai restaurant "Keawjai", next to hotel on left hand side there are chinese restaurant, Izakaya restaurant. You can find 7-11, Lawson along way down to hotel from JR station and Family mart is next to hotel just only 1 block distance (1 min walk).There are few department stores TERMINA (Food Garden at B1F: Supermarket), Arcakit (big Daiso shop at 6th floor), OIOI, PARCO (Metro Kinshicho Station is located at B2F).I really recommend this hotel as a great location and value for money: 1 station to famous Tokyo Skytree, 2 station to Asakusa (Sensoji Temple), 3 station to Akihabara, 5 station to Ueno, 7 station to Ginza, 9 station to Narita Terminal Airport.Thank you all staffs, I will be back to stay at this hotel on next visit of Tokyo.

This hotel is located very near to the Kinshicho railway station. We arrived well before check-in time of 1500hrs having flown over-night. Whilst we were not able to check in early, they were very happy to look after our luggage whilst we went out to eat. As is usual in Japan the room was small but impeccably clean, as was the whole hotel. The small room inevitably lacked much storage for clothes and our large suitcases were a little challenging. The bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning very efficient. Smoking and non-smoking rooms available. The hotel provided toiletries, pyjamas and slippers.They also provided a free smart phone for customer use outside the hotel,(very useful!) and a multi function charging cable for your own devises.Great attention to detail with regards to customer comfort and convenience. We found the hotel very quiet. Lifts had keycard security preventing non-guests from accessing guest accommodation. Reception was open 24hrs and was very efficient. Staff very welcoming. The area around the hotel was lively but not raucous with lots of places to eat and shop. With the nearby station and underground, access all over Tokyo was easy. I would certainly use this hotel again but I think I would re-think my luggage requirements! Recommended.

The location is convenience, easy to go to north and south exit of Kinshicho Station for about 3~5 minutes. Area of the room surprised us that is enough to open 4 luggage (29' for 2, 24' for 1, 20' for 1), but the acoustic insulation is a little bad.

The location is conveniently close to the JR station with loads of restaurants around. The ameneties provided and size of the room is reasonable (Japanese standard) with the price. The rooms and facilities are clean, neat and tidy. It also provides guests with free samples of DHC facial and body care products, apart from the normal toiletries, which is a big plus as I happened to have forgotten to bring body lotion and the packets saved my skin from breaking in the dry weather.Last but not least, the service of the staff are great. I have left a something in the hotel room and didn't realize it until a week later after my trip. The staff have kept the item for me and offered much assistance in helping me to retrieve it. Thank you so much, especially Receptionist Tsugumi, who was most prompt in responding and most helpful!

1. Location is super convenient. It is located near the South Exit of JR Kinshicho Station, about 3 minutes' walk. There are lots of restaurants, shops and convenience stores nearby, and everything goes easily! The neighborhood is generally safe and quiet! 2. The facilities are new for this hotel, which made the experience very comfy to us! 3. There is a/c inside the room (even during winter!), and we could adjust the temperature by ourselves! This is a big plus to this hotel! [Because for other hotels, they usually only have heating inside the room during winter and the temperature is often too hot and too dry!] We love the fact that we could enjoy some cool air inside our room at this nice hotel! :) 4. There is a handy inside the room, for travelling purpose to visitors, which is very useful for those who don't know Japanese at all! 5. Staffs are in general nice and helpful!

The location is the best. Close to everywhere. Name they have it! Train station,subwaay, dept store, toshinoya, conveyor sushi, starbucks, bakery. Ramen house, dept store, fish store!Hotel housekeeping and lobby are very helpful!I will be back!

Just as expected, friendly staff, very close to the JR Kinshichō Station, like a two minute walk, lots of cheap eateries around. Close to two giant shopping malls. Very near convenience stores like lawson 7/eleven and family mart. Overall a convenient based especially if you use the shinkansen a lot. Near Tokyo skytree and Asakusa and Akihabara. For any Muslims staying, there's a Tokyo Muslim Chinese Restaurant just next to it. Very convenient for halal food. Highly recommended.

Decided on the hotel for its reasonable price. Fairly new hotel as it was opened in Dec 2017. First time staying in the Kinshicho area hence, did not know what to expect. The hotel website provided basic information that it was a 3-minute walk from JR Sobu Line Kinshicho Station / South exit and turned on the Google directions and was able to get to the hotel within 5 minutes.Sotetsu Fresa Inn hotels abide by their check-in policy hence, it was strictly no check-in before 3pm but guests are welcome to leave their luggage at the hotel. Just don't loose the luggage number tag.Lobby is at Level 1 and guests are welcome to the coffee machine from 3pm to 11pm. The hotel does not provide bottled water and there are only green tea sachets in the room. The powdered green tea was pretty good. If you choose Eco cleaning (means only change towels, replenish the toothbrush and emptying the waste basket), you'll be given one complimentary bottled water.Requested for quiet room and was given one at the 14th floor. There is a Family Mart combini just behind the hotel (2 minutes). The oden from the convenience store was pretty good. Nearby the hotel towards the Arcakit direction (about 6 minutes away), and past the short tunnel for pedestrians, there is a shop that sells seafood bento like kaisen don for just 540 yen! Walk further and one could see the Tokyo Skytree (about 1.6 km away from the hotel).Around the hotel area, there are a couple of shops selling soba, ramen, indian food, sushi and gyoza.At the hotel lobby, do remember to take the bath salt. Also loved the fact that they provided face moisturizer as one of the free amenities for guests.
Great location, the hotel is very clean, rooms are small but that's Tokyo.Very useful is the free smartphone for guests so you don't need to buy sd cards or rent a wifi pocket device. Recomended!!!.

It's a given that hotel rooms in Japan are small. But we got connecting rooms and it kinda made our space a little bigger. The rooms and bathrooms were clean. There's free wifi in the rooms plus there's a handy phone you can use too. It's conveniently located near the JR and subway stations. There are lots of restaurants and convenience stores around the area. The staff were very pleasant too. I will definitely stay here again!

The room was great and clean，just one little thing，there was a small bloodstain on the bed sheet，I thought housekeeping will replace it once they make up the room, but they didn’t for the whole stay. the rest all prefect.

We stayed for 5 nights with one single room and one for triple room. The price is the budget and worth to pay. The room size is a little bit small for the single room but for triple room is suitable size. The safety is good, you have to use the key card of elevator and access to the room.The room furnish were good condition and complete for amenity. Furthermore, they had complimentary for you nearby the lobby on the first floor. Also the vending machine, Ice machine (Free) and washing machine on the second floor.The location is very good regarding it nearby Kinshicho station (Both Metro and JR from 3 mins by walk) and surround with many local restaurant, 7-11, Lawson and Family Mart.The staff was helpful and tries to help you as much as they can even the boundary of language. Lovely.Recommend for everyone, it worth for.

(+) New Hotel!(+) Very Clean(+) Easy Access to public transport (about +/- 5 minute walk to JR Station & Subway Stasion)(+) Easy Access to Convince Store (7Eleven, Family Mart, Lawson)(+) Fast WiFi(-) the room is a bit too small

Early Booking is good deal , room is clean and come with air purifier in each room . Just around the corner have a delicious ramen noodle restaurant open 4am morning. close the akihabara and Toyko, just need 2 station to reach there . Most probably will stay this hotel again but in Osaka , Shinsaibashi

Stayed 10 nights over 2 diff rooms.Great reasons to stay here, budget friendly, new and superb location. Prices are competitive and imo better than Airbnb as the amenities and provisions are comprehensive. You get bath salts to choose from at the lobby, tea, and whatever small toiletries you can think off, even like facial masks!the room itself provides a phone for your entire stay! android device with free data so maybe u can save more without renting those wifi devices. room also provides this multi port cable at the bedside catering for micro usb, usb-c, lightning and the works.The times i stayed there over 2 diff room had diff designs. One was slightly better as it had this shelf over the hanger bar as this was better.Finally the location, funny how u take things for granted once its gone. When i was in nagoya, with my hotel further away from the train stn, i always fondly think back to how convenient sotetsu was. But thats not all! Kinshicho Stn also has a direct bus shuttle to Haneda Airport. We all hate lugging our 30kg+ luggage at the end of your trip and this will help ease that suffering a lot.Would stay here again, also recommend couples getting their own room as it is probably more worth it than being crammed

Stayed here four nights. The hotel is quite new, very clean, with an attractive and modern decor. The rooms are extremely small. The staff were very friendly, genuine, and helpful.The coin laundry and vending machines were handy. For the price it would be nice if there were some more amenities, ex. a fitness room or sento.The location (near the station) was convenient and I liked that the neighbourhood was a bit quieter. Overall a good, basic, clean night's sleep – but next trip I would probably try a different hotel with larger rooms and more amenities.

This is not my first time in Japan , in fact having a multiple entry visa I have visited this beautiful country 5-6 times already . Sure hotel / hostel rooms are really small with tiny toilets as well . But this one had such a tiny space for a doubleOccupancy room . My husband and I barely could move with our luggage ( we only had 1) occupying partOf the entrance already. The bed had in fact only one side accessible as the other side is already pushed beside the wall . I suggest they convert this room into a singleOccupancy room that way they can put a single instead of a double bed inside the room amd therefore provide more space for the occupant to move . Buffet breakfast was the same all straight 3 days that we were there I hope something can be done to add varietyBig PLUS was the Filipina house keeping staff on the 5th floor . She cleaned our room really spic and span and had the most genuine and sweet smile for us . Other plusAlthough location is about 30 mins away from Shinjuku via train ride which is where all the action is , the train station was walking distance about 2 mins away . Restaurants , bakeshop , convenient stores , Life grocery and 2 other malls are just around the corner and all walkable .

Please note that I stayed for 7 Days in this HotelValue for money:The price in alright where it is not expensive nor cheap but worth it. The cheapest is subjective depending on how much you are willing to spend on accomodations.Location:The hotel is a 2 min walk from Kinshicho Station which is a station away from the Tokyo Skytree via Hanzomon Line 2 station away from Asakusa via Hanzomon Line, 3 station from Akihabara via Chou-Sobu Line. Shinjuku, Nakano and Shibuya is easily accessible with no line transfers required. The most convenient line in Kinshicho is the Rapid Sobu Line where it is connected to Narita International Airport which is cheaper than NEX and Skyline but the travel time is longer (est. 1.5 hour). At the basement of the station, there is a grocery store and a Yodobashi Camera from the Ground Floor up to the 3rd Floor. Please note that there are other facilities in the upper floor of the station. In front of the station(South Exit) is Marui as well as a Bus Stat

Staff were excellent and very welcoming, room was cleaned every day, free WiFi was great, bathroom utensils were provided like Shampoo and Body Wash, also the hotel was close to the Kinshicho station so getting to stations like Tokyo and Akihabara were easy to get to, I will definitely come again

The hotel is a perfect location to explore Tokyo, close to Akihabara, Asakusa, and Tokyo Skytree. The service was great. The amenities were convenient. The room was very clean and very comfortable to stay. The only problem was the WiFi, I hope they can fix it. I would come back here.

Location near to Kinshicho Station is very convenient. Staff very helpful. Room good standard, clean and comfortable. Room was small but typical for Tokyo. Breakfast was very good, lots of choice. Loads of handy restaurants nearby. Complimentary PJs were a nice touch.

The rooms are very clean, quite, and sufficient for a comfortable stay. The Japanese breakfast offers plenty of choices; the miso soup is very yummy. No fruits, but plenty of salads. It is very close to the Kinshicho station and has plenty of restaurant whichever way one turns. 7-11 and Lawson are not far away. Over all, a great place for a comfortable stay.
